text:
"smooth" renamed in "smoothing_fwhm"

The "smooth" parameter has been renamed in "smoothing_fwhm" for clarity.
The original name has been kept in _smooth_array() and image.smooth().

Some minor fixes have been performed as well.
API: smooth: param renamed to fwhm
Removed an unused line in example.

Added resampling to NiftiMapsMasker

Resampling is performed on maps or mask and images, depending on the "target"
parameter, which gives the image whose shape/affine is the reference. Two
targets have been implemented so far: "maps" and "mask".

Tests have been written, they only check for correct shape/affine, not for
the content.
DOC: alphabetic ordering of reference

Add an example using MSDL atlas

plot_msdl_covariance_advanced.py demonstrates usage of an atlas without
the same shape/affine as the data. Two different methods are implemented
(with/without NiftiMapsMasker).
Renamed "target" into "resampling_target"
TEST: fix a test under recent numpys
Simplified examples.

DOC: numpy doc standards

The return was not displayed in the doc, as the required section title is
'Returns'
DOC: fix rst in docstring
MISC: index with float is deprecated in numpy
DOC: add nisl.image to reference doc

DOC: misc naming change

This is more of a tutorial than a user guide

Renamed "smooth" parameters to "fwhm"

Everywhere "smooth" was used as a parameter, is was renamed in "fwhm", to
be consistent with image.smooth().

Added resampling to NiftiLabelsMasker

resampling_target parameter has been added to NiftiLabelsMasker. Only one
target has been implemented: labels, because resampling labels is considered
dangerous right now.

Corrected a bug in NiftiMapsMasker: the interpolation method used for "maps"
and "mask" targets were swapped.

Strengthened io/nifti_region.py tests.

Miscellaneous fixes
DOC: Fix see also

Merge pull request #57 from pgervais/nifti_maps_masker

Added NiftiMapsMasker and tests.
issues: [{u'raw': u'#57', u'refstyle': u'#d', u'parts': [u'nilearn', u'nilearn', u'57', u'']}]

text:
Strengthened io/nifti_region.py tests.

Miscellaneous fixes

Added resampling to NiftiMapsMasker

Resampling is performed on maps or mask and images, depending on the "target"
parameter, which gives the image whose shape/affine is the reference. Two
targets have been implemented so far: "maps" and "mask".

Tests have been written, they only check for correct shape/affine, not for
the content.

Renamed "smooth" parameters to "fwhm"

Everywhere "smooth" was used as a parameter, is was renamed in "fwhm", to
be consistent with image.smooth().

Add an example using MSDL atlas

plot_msdl_covariance_advanced.py demonstrates usage of an atlas without
the same shape/affine as the data. Two different methods are implemented
(with/without NiftiMapsMasker).

"smooth" renamed in "smoothing_fwhm"

The "smooth" parameter has been renamed in "smoothing_fwhm" for clarity.
The original name has been kept in _smooth_array() and image.smooth().

Some minor fixes have been performed as well.
Renamed "target" into "resampling_target"
Simplified examples.

Added resampling to NiftiLabelsMasker

resampling_target parameter has been added to NiftiLabelsMasker. Only one
target has been implemented: labels, because resampling labels is considered
dangerous right now.

Corrected a bug in NiftiMapsMasker: the interpolation method used for "maps"
and "mask" targets were swapped.
